meanings.definition: To put in a particular place or position.
meanings.sent1: I will emplace the book on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She emplaced the vase on the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to emplace itself in the tiny box.
meanings.sent4: He emplaced his trust in her like a precious jewel.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces perfectly emplace together.

meanings.definition: To establish or set up in a particular location.
meanings.sent1: The company plans to emplace a new office in the city.
meanings.sent2: They emplaced a security system around the building.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to emplace a new dish on the menu.
meanings.sent4: She emplaced her dreams in the heart of the city.
meanings.sent5: The artist emplaced his masterpiece in the center of the gallery.
